Wide Field Infrared Survey Telescope¶

  • The Wide Field Infrared Survey Telescope (WFIRST) is a NASA observatory designed to unravel the secrets of dark energy and dark matter, search for and image exoplanets, and explore many topics in infrared astrophysics. WFIRST has a 2.4m telescope, the same size as Hubble’s, but with a view 100 times greater than Hubble’s. WFIRST was the top-ranked large space mission in the 2010 Decadal Survey of Astronomy and Astrophysics, and is slated to launch in the mid-2020s.

Basic Information:¶

  • WFIRST website

  • Spacecraft and Instrument Parameters (Cycle 7)

    • These parameters refer to the telescope design as specified in Design Cycle 7 or the 2015 WFIRST-AFTA Science Definition Team and WFIRST Study Office Report.

  • WFIRST Reference Information (Cycle 7)

    • Current (06/2019) design information of WFIRST instruments.

  • Characterization of Exoplanet Atmospheres with the Optical Coronagraph on WFIRST

  • Simulations of the WFIRST Supernova Survey and Forecasts of Cosmological Constraints

  • WFIRST Wavelength Calibration: A Strategy with M67

  • Will Gaia be precise enough to solve for the geometric distortion of the WFI?

Software and Pipeline:¶

  • WFIRST Software and Simulation Tools

    • One page summary of available softwares

  • wfirst-tools - Instructions and tutorials for WFIRST software tools distributed by STScI for the science community

  • STScI-STIPS - the Space Telescope Imaging Product Simulator

    • It is designed to create simulations of full-detector post-pipeline astronomical scenes for any telescope. Now works for both JWST and WFIRST.

  • Chris Hirata’s WFIRST Galaxy Survey Exposure Time Calculator
